intro: Oxystigma mortehanii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Oxystigma mortehanii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
